commit.message:
Regenerate test certificates with sha256 signatures

Fixes this issue with OpenSSL 1.1.0:
Exception in thread Thread-1:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/threading.py", line 932, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/tests/runwsgi.py", line 67, in run
    bottle.run(self.app, server=self.server, quiet=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/bottle.py", line 3129, in run
    server.run(app)
  File "/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/tests/runwsgi.py", line 38, in run
    self.srv.socket = ssl.wrap_socket(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/ssl.py", line 1402, in wrap_socket
    context.load_cert_chain(certfile, keyfile)
ssl.SSLError: [SSL: CA_MD_TOO_WEAK] ca md too weak (_ssl.c:4022)

Fix seek callback's use of offset parameter

This was discovered by the seek_cb_test which was failing on certain
architectures (e.g., armhf):

FAIL: test_seek_function (tests.seek_cb_test.SeekCbTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/tests/seek_cb_test.py", line 77, in test_seek_function
    self.assertEqual('1234567890.1234567890', content)
AssertionError: '1234567890.1234567890' != '12345678901234567890.1234567890'
- 1234567890.1234567890
+ 12345678901234567890.1234567890
? ++++++++++

Exclude fake-curl binaries from distribution

This is a problem mainly when trying to run the tests on non-x86_64 platforms.
'make test' will not recompile the .so files and thus they will be the wrong
architecture.

commit.message: Fix runtime error on no-SSL builds

Increase minimum libcurl version for curl_global_sslset

Although curl_global_sslset() is present in 7.56.0, it contained several bugs
which prevent it from being used as currently implemented in PycURL.
Specifically, older versions of curl_global_sslset did not work properly when
-1 was passed as the first argument.  Also, it did not always return the
available backends.  Rather than attempt to handle these quirks in PycURL, just
increment the minimum libcurl version.

Relevant bugs:
https://curl.haxx.se/bug/?i=3346
https://curl.haxx.se/bug/?i=2499

commit.message:
Add UPLOAD_BUFFER configuration option

Allow configuring size of upload buffer:
https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/2896

Add MAXAGE_CONN configuration option

Allow configuring maximum age for connection reuse:
https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/3782

Add support for sharing connection cache

This feature has been available since libcurl 7.57.0:
https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/2043

Support the CURLOPT_HAPROXYPROTOCOL option in pycurl (#630)

* In libcurl 7.60 the --haproxy-protocol option was added (https://twitter.com/curlcommits/status/974961166807109633)

Co-authored-by: Russell McConnachie <pmcconna@cisco.com>

verification.payload:

commit.message: Add a 'clean' target for fake-curl

Support overriding CC, respect *FLAGS in fake-curl

The shipped libraries (obviously) do not work on non-amd64 platforms,
and rebuilding without the correct compiler and flags does not work
on more complex setups such as ppc64 with 32-bit userland.  Make
the Makefile permit CC override while preserving the current default,
and use user-provided CFLAGS, CPPFLAGS and LDFLAGS.
